oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Report from L. Wheeler, Quartermaster's Agent, detailing the loyalty to the U. S. Government of specific individuals, all of Marion County. Of the 31 persons listed only seven (Esther C. Hall, John D. Wynix, Owen R. Been, James Griffith, Margaret A. Murphy, James Brigmore, and John Hudson) received classification as disloyal always.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Record Group 21, Adjutant General's Office Records, 1796-1900
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Vouchers of loyalty were important in the post-Civil War period to prove a citizen did not actively participate in war against the Union. Without them many Southern citizens could not vote or hold office. Records of investigations and loyalty oaths were required post-war for consideration of payment by the Quartermaster's Department.
